109  [[nodiscard]] RJ::Time begin_time() const {
110  if (instants_.empty()) {
111  return RJ::now();
112  }
113 
114  return first().stamp;
115  }
116 
120  [[nodiscard]] RJ::Time end_time() const {
121  if (instants_.empty()) {
122  return RJ::now();
123  }
124 
125  return last().stamp;
126  }
127 
131  [[nodiscard]] RJ::Seconds duration() const {
132  return end_time() - begin_time();
133  }
134

233  RobotInstant& first() {
234  if (empty()) {
235  throw std::runtime_error(
236  "Can't get the first() instant in an empty trajectory");
237  }
238  return instants_.front();
239  }

246  throw std::runtime_error(
247  "Can't get the first() instant in an empty trajectory");
248  }
249  return instants_.front();
250  }

256  RobotInstant& last() {
257  if (empty()) {
258  throw std::runtime_error(
259  "Can't get the last() instant in an empty trajectory");
260  }
261  return instants_.back();
262  }
263 
264  [[nodiscard]] const RobotInstant& last() const {
265  if (empty()) {
266  throw std::runtime_error(
267  "Can't get the last() instant in an empty trajectory");
268  }
269  return instants_.back();
270  }

309  /*
310  * @brief Allows seeking to arbitrary positions in a Trajectory and
311  * incrementing by arbitrary steps.
312  */
313  class Cursor {
314  public:
318  Cursor(const Trajectory& trajectory, RJ::Time start_time);
319 
323  Cursor(const Trajectory& trajectory);
324 
328  Cursor(const Trajectory& trajectory,
329  RobotInstantSequence::const_iterator iterator);
330 
335  [[nodiscard]] bool has_value() const {
336  return trajectory_.check_time(time_);
337  }
338 
342  [[nodiscard]] RobotInstant value() const;
343 
349  void seek(RJ::Time time);
350 
360  void advance(RJ::Seconds seconds);
361 
367  void next_knot();
368 
373  [[nodiscard]] RJ::Time time() const { return time_; }
374 
379  [[nodiscard]] std::optional<RJ::Time> time_next() const {
380  if (iterator_ == trajectory_.instants_end() ||
381  iterator_ + 1 == trajectory_.instants_end()) {
382  return std::nullopt;
383  }
384  return (iterator_ + 1)->stamp;
385  }
386 
387  private:
388  const Trajectory& trajectory_;
389 
390  // An iterator pointing to the knot point at or immediately before the
391  // time point referred to by `time_`.
392  RobotInstantSequence::const_iterator iterator_;
393  RJ::Time time_;
394  };
395 
399  [[nodiscard]] Cursor cursor(RJ::Time start_time) const;
400 
404  [[nodiscard]] Cursor cursor_begin() const;
405 
413  void mark_angles_valid() { has_angle_profile_ = true; }
414 
418  [[nodiscard]] bool angles_valid() const { return has_angle_profile_; }
419 
423  [[nodiscard]] const RobotInstantSequence& instants() const { return instants_; }
424 
425 private:
426  // A sorted array of RobotInstants (by timestamp)
427  RobotInstantSequence instants_;
428 
429  // Time this trajectory was created. If the trajectory is not yet finished,
430  // this will be std::nullopt.
431  std::optional<RJ::Time> creation_stamp_;
432 
433  std::optional<std::string> debug_text_;
434 
435  // Whether or not this has been profiled.
436  bool has_angle_profile_{false};
437 };

440 
441 namespace rj_convert {
442 
443 template <>
444 struct RosConverter<planning::Trajectory, rj_msgs::msg::Trajectory> {
445  static rj_msgs::msg::Trajectory to_ros(const planning::Trajectory& from) {
446  if (!from.angles_valid()) {
447  throw std::invalid_argument("Cannot serialize trajectory with invalid angles");
448  }
449  return rj_msgs::build<rj_msgs::msg::Trajectory>()
450  .stamp(convert_to_ros(from.time_created().value()))
451  .instants(convert_to_ros(from.instants()));
452  }
453 
454  static planning::Trajectory from_ros(const rj_msgs::msg::Trajectory& from) {
455  auto trajectory = planning::Trajectory{convert_from_ros(from.instants)};
456  trajectory.stamp(convert_from_ros(from.stamp));
457  trajectory.mark_angles_valid();
458  return trajectory;
459  }
460 };
461 
462 ASSOCIATE_CPP_ROS(planning::Trajectory, planning::Trajectory::Msg);
463 
464 } // namespace rj_convert
